alert.note: Alert for Coke; Fisher; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Coke, Nolan and Fisher Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hermleigh to near Silver. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Roscoe, Blackwell, Nolan, Roby, Maryneal, Sylvester, Hobbs, Mccaulley, Sanco, Longworth, Hylton, Silver, Fort Chadbourne, Wastella, Champion, Lake Sweetwater, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147, Camp Boothe Oaks and Gannon. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
